media:group.media:title: Common Problems in Calculating Dilutions
media:group.media:description:
The process of preparing solutions often involves the use of a deceptively simple formula.  In this video, I show you how to avoid some of the most common errors that are made by students using this formula.

0:00 - Introduction
0:52 - Problem #1 (C-what?, V-what?)
1:45 - Let's visualize this problem
4:02 - Applying what you've learned
11:15 - Problem #2 ("plug & play")
12:34 - Converting the units
13:30 - The correct way to do this
14:52 - Problem #3 (not dealing with complexity)
15:36 - Let's visualize this problem
16:21 - Common error made in such cases
17:10 - The correct way to approach this
21.13 - Don't forget about the water (solvent)
